description.narrative: By 2022, children, families and communities, including in schools, early childhood development centres and health-care facilities, are empowered to collectively adopt positive WASH practices and demand for better WASH services.

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

UNICEF Programmes in Pakistan (Emergencies Disaster Risk Reduction)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, children, families and communities, including in schools, early childhood development centres and health-care facilities, are empowered to collectively adopt positive WASH practices and demand for better WASH services.

description.narrative: UNICEF and provincial governments implemented WASH social and behaviour change communication strategies which contributed to more household basic sanitation facilities being constructed and used, safe water use, and hygiene practices. 1,590 villages became free of open defecation and only 85 slipped to open defecation. A smart sanitation technologies (Apps) to identify public toilets and assess functionality developed in 2019 would help with tracking of slippage in 2020.. Menstrual hygiene management services were made available at 1,103 schools, providing 164,484 adolescent girls with safe, hygienic means to manage menstruation and reduce risk of school dropout. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of people (men, women, boys and girls) with increased knowledge, attitude & practicing improved hygiene behaviours and living in healthy environments
Number of communities previously certified open defecation free that no longer maintained its ODF status (slippage)

actual.value:
2019:National=85 Balochistan =Data not available KP = 60 Punjab = 25 Sindh =Data not available
(Sindh and Balochistan did not carry out any sustainability study to understand the slippages).

title.narrative: Number of schools with Menstrual Hygiene Management implemented in schools programmes as a result of UNICEF direct support and/or leveraged through national programmes.
